document_data.name: The Roving Rune
document_data.occupants:
[[Raisa el Catahras]] in 1370 DR
[[Oma el Catahras]] in 1370 DR
document_data.mainbody: '''The Roving Rune''' was a well-known inn, tavern, and brewery in [[Teshburl]].
document_data.Structure: The inn was located in an old [[wikipedia:en:Minaret|minaret]], a former [[wizard]]'s tower with four levels.

Interior.Fourth Floor: This level contained the residence of the innkeeper and his family. In [[1370 DR]], it was occupied by [[Atiq el Catahras]] and his wife and daughter.
Interior.Second and Third Floors: These floors contained the guest rooms, which could be rented by the night or by the hour for a moderate fee.
Interior.First Floor: The ground floor contained a brewery for the tavern below.
Interior.Basement: The basement cellar was the largest room, the inn's taproom and tavern.
Interior.Sub-basement: A hidden level existed in the minaret below the basement tavernâ€”a magical room. In [[1370 DR]], it was used by the innkeeper's daughter, [[Oma el Catahras|Oma]], for her magical studies, taught by her mother, [[Raisa el Catahras|Raisa]].

document_data.Services: The Roving Rune offered a rare (for Teshburl) non-nautical theme. It provided some of the best food and entertainment around.
document_data.History: Atiq el Catahras inherited the tower from his uncle, who was a wizard, but he was unaware of all of the tower's secrets.
document_data.Rumors and Legends: Touching the roving rune was apparently a very pleasant experience, which was in part why the tavern maintained such a popularity. Those who were sad found their spirits brightened. For these reasons, many planned to say their goodbyes in the inn, hoping the rune would be spotted.
